data.quote: Information is not knowledge, and knowledge is not wisdom. Reading - even browsing - an old book can yield sustenance denied by a database search. Patience is a virtue, gluttony a sin.

data.quote: There are three lessons in philanthropy - one, involve the family, especially the spouse. She can be a remarkable driver of your initiative. Two, you need to build an institution, and you need to scale it up. Choose a leader for philanthropy whom you trust. Three, philanthropy needs patience, tenacity and time.
data.author: Azim Premji

data.quote: For correct writing, the cultivation of patience and mental accuracy is essential. Throughout the young author's period of apprenticeship, he must keep reliable dictionaries and textbooks at his elbow; eschewing as far as possible that hasty extemporaneous manner of writing which is the privilege of more advanced students.
data.author: H. P. Lovecraft

data.quote: Storytelling is about patience, about making sense of the moments of pathos and beauty that you find, and about carrying these moments back into your own life.
data.author: Michael Paterniti

data.quote: The biggest thing I possess is infinite patience. Once you are patient, things fall in place.
data.author: Mohammad Azharuddin

data.quote: You have to be very strong and headstrong to make your place. You have to know how to say no. Patience is very important.
data.author: Yami Gautam

data.quote: To the fans, thank you for your patience and concern. They've been on point with my career, especially after my injuries.
data.author: Rey Mysterio

data.quote: Luck is a component that a lot of people in the arts sometimes fail to recognise: that you can have talent, perseverance, patience, but without luck you will not have a successful career.
data.author: Bryan Cranston

data.quote: When things begin accelerating wildly out of control, sometimes patience is the only answer. Press pause.
data.author: Douglas Rushkoff

data.quote: I don't think patience is something that any of us grow up with in a large dose. It's a world of instant gratification.
data.author: Tim Cope

data.quote: No one thought the Mayweather-Pacquiao fight would happen, but I had patience.
data.author: Floyd Mayweather, Jr.

data.quote: The one thing about the business of entertainment is that you have to learn patience.
data.author: Kevin Hart

data.quote: I was a big Guns N' Roses fan when I was seven. My friend who lived across the street had long dark curly hair and I had long blonde hair, so I'd dress up as Axl and she'd be Slash, and we'd rock out in front of the mirror singing 'Patience.'
data.author: Kirsten Dunst

data.quote: I've learned the importance of loving what you do. I have also learned more patience due to the nature of the music business.
data.author: Randy Travis

data.quote: It seems likely that many of the young who don't wait for others to call them artists, but simply announce that they are, don't have the patience to make art.
data.author: Pauline Kael

data.quote: I think my best teacher and my best study was theater in general. It taught me a lot of patience and a lot of hard work, and I think that theater teaches you that you've got to know your stuff because you only get one chance.
data.author: Chelsea Kane

data.quote: I think every war certainly wears on national will and national patience, particularly a counterinsurgency.
data.author: Stanley A. McChrystal

data.quote: I have not the smarts or patience for political office.
data.author: Henry Rollins

data.quote: A certain amount of impatience may be useful to stimulate and motivate us to action. However, I believe that a lack of patience is a major cause of the difficulties and unhappiness in the world today.
data.author: Joseph B. Wirthlin

data.quote: Brad will tell you. He puts a movie on, I'm asleep in 10 minutes. I have no patience. But the kids love action movies with comedy, Jackie Chan and all that.
data.author: Angelina Jolie

data.quote: When, President Obama, do you mean to cease abusing our patience? How long is that madness of yours still to mock us? When is there to be an end to that unbridled audacity of yours swaggering about as it does now?
data.author: Ted Cruz

data.quote: A healthy male adult bore consumes each year one and a half times his own weight in other people's patience.
data.author: John Updike

data.quote: I have no patience for anyone who thinks they've figured things out, no patience for people who think they're right at the expense of everyone else. The world is too connected and too complicated to conform to any of our rigid ideas of what it should be like.
data.author: Moby

data.quote: The best thing Jay-Z ever taught me was patience.
data.author: Rita Ora

data.quote: Who ever is out of patience is out of possession of their soul.
data.author: Francis Bacon

data.quote: I like playing. I wouldn't be a good coach. I don't have the patience to be a coach.
data.author: Tom Brady

data.quote: Dating someone on the opposite end of the happy spectrum teaches you an incredible amount of patience.
data.author: Chris Pine

data.quote: My advice to someone to follow in my footsteps is to have patience. I've been doing this for twelve years.
data.author: Christina Milian

data.quote: It's funny with jeans now, because if they don't feel like a pair of sweatpants, I don't have patience for them anymore! I think I'm becoming increasingly lazy.
data.author: Claire Danes

data.quote: There was a solid year and a half, perhaps two years, after making 'Temple Grandin,' when I didn't do anything. I just didn't have much patience for roles that were silly, or light, or inconsequential.
data.author: Claire Danes

data.quote: It is necessary for him who would endure existence with patience that he should conceive himself to be something - that he should be persuaded he is not a cipher in the muster-roll of man.
data.author: William Godwin

data.quote: No, I wouldn't direct a movie, no. I couldn't. I don't have the patience for it, I don't have the people skills. You have to be clever. I'm not really clever in that kind of way. And you have to be able to manipulate people, but at the same time allow them to feel like they are manipulating you, to get the kind of movie that you want.
data.author: Nick Cave

data.quote: Opera is complex for those who perform it, but also for those who listen to it. It takes more time, more patience and more spirit of sacrifice. All this is well worth it because opera offers such deep sensations that they will remain in a heart for a lifetime.
data.author: Andrea Bocelli

data.quote: Punk rock has never really had much patience with musical virtuosity. Actually, it'd be more accurate to say that for most of its history, punk has been actively hostile to virtuosity.
data.author: James Surowiecki

data.quote: I started 'SNL,' and I became the one who did impressions. I did that, but then I wanted to get an original character on, and that took a long time to get one on that stuck. And then I got Vinny Vedecci on - 'Oh great' - and then it took a couple more seasons to get Greg the Alien on. You have to have some patience.
data.author: Bill Hader

data.quote: If you list the qualities that we consider feminine, they are patience, understanding, empathy, supportiveness, a desire to nurture. Our culture tells us those are feminine traits, but they're really just human.
data.author: Sydney Pollack

data.quote: Bear patiently with a rival.
data.author: Ovid

data.quote: Because of my capacity for listening to strangers' tales, or the details of their lives, my patience with their food and their crotchets, my curiosity that borders on nosiness, I am told that anyone traveling with me experiences an unbelievable tedium, and this is why I choose to travel alone.
data.author: Paul Theroux

data.quote: I think patience is a skill and I wish I had it.
data.author: David Duchovny

data.quote: I always had that long-term vision. Even getting going with cinema, knowing it was such a long road to be able to make films, but I always had a long term. Whenever I was starting out, I had that patience.
data.author: Richard Linklater

data.quote: No one who strives with full faith and heart for the blessings of eternal life will be denied. And how great will be the joy and how much deeper the appreciation then after enduring in patience and faith now.
data.author: Henry B. Eyring

data.quote: Let us wait in patience for the Christ-child whose own life depended on the lives of Mary and Joseph. The Word of God was made flesh. He came so that we might experience the fullness of time.
data.author: Stanley Hauerwas

data.quote: Temperamentally I'm not a natural producer, because I don't have the patience.
data.author: Damian Lewis

data.quote: For some reason, every time I get a little bit under the weather, I've got zero patience.
data.author: Jason Day

data.quote: I've got to really try and manage my patience out there.
data.author: Jason Day

data.quote: You know, writing is really difficult, and it takes a real patience and a skill. I don't know if I have that. I admire it in others, so much, and I envy it.
data.author: Adam Scott

data.quote: I have declared that patience is never more than patient. I too have declared, that I who am not patient am patient.
data.author: Gertrude Stein

data.quote: People are stubborn about what they perceive to be the right thing or the wrong thing, and it takes a long time to filter this human condition. There's a waiting period until people catch up. But if you have patience - which it takes when someone thinks differently from you - everybody always catches up. That patience is a wonderful virtue.
data.author: Johnny Mathis

data.quote: Golf is all about patience - one tournament is four days long, 18 holes a day.
data.author: Lindsey Vonn

data.quote: Patience can be a good thing - but not necessarily. Sometimes it's not so bad to be impatient. I'm a little bit too polite.
data.author: Helen Mirren

data.quote: I recall my mum tried to teach me how to fry chicken once, and I almost burned down half the kitchen... I don't think I have the patience for cooking.
data.author: Ne-Yo

data.quote: I don't play pyrotechnic scales. I play about frustration, patience, anger. Music is an extension of my soul.
data.author: Dick Dale

data.quote: I've been accused of riding roughshod over others' emotions, and I admit, when I feel a friend is being over-indulgent, my patience is in short supply.
data.author: Mariella Frostrup

data.quote: If I spent all my time criticising myself, I wouldn't be able to function. There are actors who theorise till the cows come home. I haven't the patience for them. It's maybe shallow, but that's why I'll never be part of the acting set.
data.author: Anthony Hopkins

data.quote: I don't really have the patience to do my hair, which is why it's always parted down the middle, slicked, in a low ponytail or a messy high bun. I'm too lazy to do my own hair, but I like doing my makeup.
data.author: Gigi Hadid

data.quote: My mother is a ball of fire in the world, and I love that about her. But what I have learned from my stepdad is something as important, which is patience and compassion. Because when you are living with someone else, those two qualities go a long way.
data.author: Justin Timberlake

data.quote: Basically, discipline, effort, patience and courage are hugely important core values for kids to grow up embracing.
data.author: Karen Salmansohn

data.quote: I would say I'm a boss who's learning, and I hope people have the patience for the fact that I'm learning along the way because that's a tough thing.
data.author: Sophia Amoruso

data.quote: I like to take my own time, and I don't like to rush. I do take time, and I have patience.
data.author: Nargis Fakhri

data.quote: When I try to be patient on my own, my patience is forced and short-lived. It is obvious to everyone that I am desperately trying to be patient.
data.author: Mother Angelica

data.quote: When you are starting to run an online business, you need to narrow down a niche market and be able to stick with it until you have a good profit coming in. This can take a while, so you need to have a great deal of patience to make sure that your business is moving in the right direction.
data.author: Fabrizio Moreira

data.quote: When you're short on sleep, you're short on patience. You're ruder to people, less tolerant, less understanding. It's harder to relate and to pay attention for sustained periods of time.
data.author: Jason Fried

data.quote: The difference between rearing a child in your 20s and one in your 50s is one of patience.
data.author: Iman

data.quote: I would love to write a screenplay for 'Badlands' one day. I don't think I could ever have the patience to do it I don't even have the patience to write songs. I write some of the shortest songs ever because I don't have the patience.
data.author: Halsey

data.quote: Being a father has fulfilled me in parts of my life that sustain me. It gives me a comfort and patience. All actors have this hole inside that they're trying to fill by performing. I'm anxious to keep creating, but I'm not so desperate any more because I have the love and support of my kids and wife.
data.author: John C. Reilly

data.quote: I was 25 myself once. I also thought I knew everything. I also thought that I could give singers singing advice and comics comedy advice. When you're that age, you know it all, so I understand it. But when you're tired and you don't have patience for it, you definitely snap.
data.author: Lisa Lampanelli

data.quote: I'm terrible with patience.
data.author: Katherine Heigl

data.quote: Patience is the most necessary quality for business, many a man would rather you heard his story than grant his request.
data.author: Philip Stanhope, 4th Earl of Chesterfield

data.quote: I don't have a lot of patience for movies that aren't cleanly told.
data.author: Jon Favreau

data.quote: I have an equal amount of patience as my grade-school children, which is not great.
data.author: Mike D

data.quote: Patience was not my strong point.
data.author: Lauren Bacall

data.quote: To anybody who says to me, 'I'm in character,' I say, 'You should be in an asylum.' If you don't know that you're pretending, then you should really seek medical help. I don't have patience for that stuff.
data.author: D. B. Sweeney

data.quote: What I relish most is when a member of my staff, who has worked with passion and patience towards achieving their dream of owning a restaurant, walks up to me and says, 'Nobu! I have done it!'
data.author: Nobu Matsuhisa

data.quote: Al Unser Sr. was one of the smartest drivers I've ever raced against. And I often said, I wish I could've had some of his patience. I know it would have worked for me many times.
data.author: Mario Andretti

data.quote: I wish I had more patience.
data.author: Toni Collette

data.quote: I think writing novels has taught me more about the value of patience and being organized. I've learned to use timelines and wikis to track decisions and make sure everything still fits together. It's both easier and harder than writing short fiction.
data.author: Ken Liu

data.quote: When you're a crime reporter, you see the nub of what life's about, and you don't have much patience for the falsity of politics.
data.author: Heather Brooke

data.quote: To make a full-blooded puff pastry, you need time, you need patience, and you need precision. It's all about the lamination: it's all about building up the layers of butter, dough, butter, dough; as the butter melts, it creates steam, and that brings up the layers of the two doughs apart from each other, and that's what gives it the rise.
data.author: Paul Hollywood

data.quote: I have a business manager and a book-keeper who deals with our household bills. My husband and I sit down with her for a weekly report on how much money is going out, but I'm not terribly interested, and I don't have the patience for it.
data.author: Jane Green

data.quote: Endurance is the crowning quality, And patience all the passion of great hearts.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: Patience, discipline - giving everything on court... This is what I'm trying to bring in every single match.
data.author: Angelique Kerber

data.quote: TV requires a lot more patience. No one's ever like, 'I gotta get up at 5 A.M. and write my stand-up!' It's an easy life. With 'Silicon Valley,' it's long hours and very unglamorous.
data.author: Kumail Nanjiani

data.quote: Let him that hath no power of patience retire within himself, though even there he will have to put up with himself.
data.author: Baltasar Gracian

data.quote: I've no patience for people who say they never watch television. It's a great way to keep in touch with popular culture, and it's important that children can relate to what their schoolmates are watching.
data.author: Terry Wogan

data.quote: Writing novels is largely about endurance and patience. I take a lot of breaks, hit walls, and go do something else while I think things through. But I do it every day, and I try to treat it as a job, something that is not dictated by whimsy or muses.
data.author: Adam Mansbach

data.quote: Science is to be much commended for the ingenuity, the patience, and the persistency it displays in the invention of instruments wherewith to ferret out the secrets of nature.
data.author: Max Heindel

data.quote: I believe there's too little patience and context to many of the investigations I read or see on television.
data.author: Bob Woodward

data.quote: You have to have patience to be a legislator.
data.author: Gene Green

data.quote: An Englishman bears with patience any ridicule which foreigners cast upon him. John Bull never laughs so loudly as when he laughs at himself but the Americans are nationally sensitive and cannot endure that good-humoured raillery which jests at their weaknesses and foibles.
data.author: Isabella Bird

data.quote: When I returned from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology in 1972, my father was running a forging business with a turnover of Rs 3.5 crore. But I had no patience and wanted to grow the business via exports.
data.author: Baba Kalyani

data.quote: Artists know that diligence counts as much, if not more, as inspiration; in art, as in politics, patience counts as much as revolution.
data.author: Tony Kushner

data.quote: For believers, both privilege and privation are a trial, and both demand responses: one demands service, and the other demands patience. The greatest privilege is to live well in flourishing lands; the greatest privation is to live in the midst of war, especially civil war.
data.author: Hamza Yusuf

data.quote: The perfect ham and cheese sandwich is all about focusing on quality ingredients and about simple techniques. You start with great bread, a well-cured ham and a sharp local cheese, and the rest is easy. A little butter in a pan and a little patience - in the end you'll have a sandwich that is at once comforting and delicious.
data.author: Daniel Humm

data.quote: I'm constantly looking for ways to learn and elevate your craft, patience for yourself, and patience for this business. It's not a fair business. You may be great, but it may take years for someone to notice what you're capable of because of politics.
data.author: Aldis Hodge

data.quote: Writing is boring, very boring, and it takes so much patience.
data.author: Ingmar Bergman

data.quote: I didn't choose 'Silver Spoons'. I think my mom and agent chose it because at that time there was a lack of patience on some of the people that were in charge of my career. I think there was a big offer on the table, and I think they took it.
data.author: Ricky Schroder

data.quote: I still have to work on patience.
data.author: Robert Mueller

data.quote: I think all musicians have at one time or another experienced one physical problem or another. I have had tendinitis a couple of times, so I try to be really careful. It takes patience and persistence to overcome injury.
data.author: Yo-Yo Ma

data.quote: My mum told me to have patience. It's about realising that when things aren't going the way you want them to, or you don't have inspiration, it will come.
data.author: Vanessa Paradis

data.quote: There is no harm in patience, and no profit in lamentation. Death is easier to bear (than) that which precedes it, and more severe than that which comes after it. Remember the death of the Apostle of God, and your sorrow will be lessened.
data.author: Abu Bakr

data.quote: I don't know the definition of a star; I am just an actor. I prefer doing hard work, as I feel luck can't do much in absence of hard work. I am a lazy person - when I entered into this industry, I thought it was a cakewalk, but I have realised it needs a lot of patience and hard work.
data.author: Emraan Hashmi

data.quote: If I am told to be at a shoot at 10 A.M., I am ready on time. By 11:30, I lose my patience. After that, I keep threatening to leave the sets if they don't begin soon. It works sometimes.
data.author: Emraan Hashmi

data.quote: Earlier, looking lighter or slimmer never mattered to me. Frankly, I didn't care. I had more important things to do. But when I figured that it's not that hard, and I have the time, passion and patience to take it up, I jumped onto the health-wagon. I started working out.
data.author: Kajol

data.quote: Movies require a lot of patience. I like instant results. If I have done something that's not funny at all, the audience will let me know in two seconds. With the movie, I will have to wait nine months to know if I was that bad.
data.author: Vir Das

data.quote: Because I'm the author of my screenplays I know what I'm looking for. It's true that I can be stubborn in demanding that I get what I want, but it's also a question of working with patience and love.
data.author: Michael Haneke

data.quote: There are very little things in this life I cannot afford and patience is one of them.
data.author: Larry Hagman

data.quote: If I could have one prayer answered, I would pray for patience. I move so fast sometimes. I try to slow down.
data.author: Debra Winger

data.quote: The first requirement of politics is not intellect or stamina but patience. Politics is a very long run game and the tortoise will usually beat the hare.
data.author: John Major

data.quote: Give your dog or cat respect, patience, understanding and love. And if you just change to one vegetarian day a week, that's a wonderful step that will save animal lives. It means you have chosen something kind instead of something cruel.
data.author: Ingrid Newkirk

data.quote: One problem with age is that patience begins to ebb.
data.author: Carl Hiaasen

data.quote: I have all the patience in the world about Sirens. For me it's not a Grateful Dead project, it's a Me project.
data.author: Jerry Garcia

data.quote: I think I have more patience now than I did in the past.
data.author: T. Boone Pickens

data.quote: Horses teach you patience and how to do things the right way so you can get the right result.
data.author: Lyle Lovett

data.quote: I always tell up-and-coming DJs you have to really love what you do and find that interest to drive you. It requires so much attention to detail, and it takes up a lot of your time. You hear a song, and there are so many little pieces that make that song work. It requires a lot of patience, diligence and resilience.
data.author: Steve Aoki

data.quote: Patience was not something that came naturally to me, but in cooking it is the quintessential skill.
data.author: Gail Simmons

data.quote: You know, I lose patience really easily; I'd rather shop in the grocery store than in the department store. I can pick an apple like nobody's business.
data.author: Gail Simmons

data.quote: I would be horrible at Twitter. I wouldn't know the answer to fans' questions half the time - and the patience involved! I couldn't imagine. I did have a Twitter account that I tried for a couple days, but found I had nothing to say.
data.author: Jim Parsons

data.quote: When I first started submitting my work professionally - and we're talking years and years ago - I had no patience for editorial response times. I hated waiting to hear back from people, hated waiting to see my work in print.
data.author: Cullen Bunn

data.quote: Does anyone want to see a person who's making the money that the newspapers say I'm making complaining, 'Woe is me, my life is terrible, and people are being unfair?' No one would've had any patience for that. I wouldn't have any patience for that.
data.author: Matt Lauer

data.quote: Everyone is given one gift, a reason for being, and it's our obligation to do something with it. Obviously, it's a challenge - but if you're not taking the bull by the horns, I have no patience for you. You're just taking up space.
data.author: Melissa Rosenberg

data.quote: When I was 20, I thought I was 30 - but I was so far from it. When you're young, you want everything to happen now. As you mature, you can look back and see all the great things you achieved with time and patience.
data.author: Elisha Cuthbert

data.quote: In this day and age, you need a lot of patience if you are in the movie business.
data.author: Brett Ratner

data.quote: Honestly, I didn't have the patience for biology or history in an academic sense, but I always liked the kind of big questions.
data.author: Andrew Bird

data.quote: The notion that patience is a virtue is something you don't fully appreciate until you're a parent. You need endless patience with little ones.
data.author: Deirdre O'Kane

data.quote: I make really good pasta sauce. The secret to getting it right is just patience and love.
data.author: Banks

data.quote: I have no patience at all.
data.author: Alan Sugar

data.quote: I make a mean pecan pie, and I have a great recipe for pralines - also using pecans. Pralines take a lot of patience, and patience is a must in the duck blind as well as in the kitchen. Good things come to those who wait.
data.author: Phil Robertson

data.quote: People ask me a lot about the values I got from playing for the Cubs for so many years. The value I got out of it was patience. A lot of people these days are not very patient.
data.author: Ernie Banks

data.quote: When you bat, you need to have a lot of patience. I started training for it from the age of eight or nine. So, I knew what I needed when I stepped on the field to bat.
data.author: Mohammad Azharuddin

data.quote: Republican patience with how unionism deals with the political institutions, and with key issues like equality and human rights, will be tested because, obviously, there will be a battle a day on these matters. So lets face up to all of this with our eyes wide open.
data.author: Gerry Adams

data.quote: Patience is the art of hoping.
data.author: Luc de Clapiers

data.quote: I'm not about my breasts; I'm just about good health, OK. I'm not afraid of doing what I need to do to stay here. I really don't understand women who are in denial, who don't want to go for a mammogram. I think it's stupidity. Sorry. I have no patience for that.
data.author: Jaclyn Smith

data.quote: If you were to ask me when I was 17 if I was mad because I didn't have a deal, I would have probably said, 'Yeah.' Now I'm so glad I got it when I got it. People tell you to be patient and wait. Patience is not a virtue of mine, but I think everything definitely happened the right way for me.
data.author: Chris Young

data.quote: My impression is that most women public service workers have a long fuse. Precisely because they care so deeply about services, more than anyone, they still want to find a sensible and fair negotiated agreement. But their patience has run out.
data.author: Frances O'Grady

data.quote: I don't have a lot of patience for boring arthouse movies.
data.author: Zoe Kazan

data.quote: Patience is key. You can't get selfish, and that's the number one thing I've learned at WWE. The world continues to go round, and I just knew - given the right opportunity and the right moment - that the world would know I was good, but now the world knows that I'm great.
data.author: Sasha Banks

data.quote: So when I do Chinese cooking, I mix everything together, then the kids have to eat their vegetables. They won't have the patience to pick them out.
data.author: Martin Yan

data.quote: The principle part of faith is patience.
data.author: George MacDonald

data.quote: For me, most writing consists of siphoning out useless pre-story matter, cutting and cutting and cutting, what seems to be endless rewriting, and what is entailed in all that is patience, and waiting, and false starts, and dead ends, and really, in a way, nerve.
data.author: Deborah Eisenberg

data.quote: I tell people a lot of times, if you want to be a part of something, you never know, you kind of just have to be around. A lot of people don't really have the patience for it, and they don't stick around. Dre and I are still working together, and we have plenty of music for the future.
data.author: Anderson Paak

data.quote: I don't think I have the ability or patience to teach badminton to others.
data.author: Saina Nehwal

data.quote: Honestly, Americans are more open-minded and have the patience and the time for new types of music. In Australia and New Zealand, you must earn your place.
data.author: Gin Wigmore

data.quote: Negative thinking patterns can be immensely deceptive and persuasive, and change is rarely easy. But with patience and persistence, I believe that nearly all individuals suffering from depression can improve and experience a sense of joy and self-esteem once again.
data.author: David D. Burns

data.quote: I think as more people use the phones to access the Internet, they have a lot less patience for trying to find things on the search engines. That is because you need to figure a lot of things out for search to work.
data.author: Adam D'Angelo

data.quote: The key to sauces is having patience. I'm not a patient woman, but I learned with sauces that you have to get everything on a slow roll and layer the flavors. That's where you get robust tastes: it starts one way and ends another.
data.author: Kelis

data.quote: My wife makes fun of me by calling me a grandpa because I have very little patience for inconsiderate children. So if we're walking in the mall, and some kid goes by really fast on a skateboard, I become the grumpiest eighty-five-year-old man in the world and start screaming at them.
data.author: Rob McClure

data.quote: The patience that goes with the game, the little things that go along with the game, you have so much more time to think in golf than you do in football - you have to keep your thoughts positive. I'm not sure I've got that mastered.
data.author: John Elway

data.quote: I've worked so hard to eliminate the inner geek from my life. I suddenly realize I have no patience for those people who still have their geeks showing. Now I see why being 'normal' has been so important to me.
data.author: Kenny Loggins

data.quote: I've said my patience is not infinite.
data.author: Darrell Issa

data.quote: Sad Patience, too near neighbour to despair.
data.author: Matthew Arnold

data.quote: Coaching takes patience. I'm more enthused when teaching players who want it versus when I have to.
data.author: Kevin Garnett

data.quote: My relationship with the Philharmonia Orchestra brought me many times to London and I will always reflect positively on that early period of development with them - their patience, their warmth, their dedication.

data.quote: Life and death are illusions. We are in a constant state of transformation.

data.quote: I'll never forget Hurricane Katrina - the mix of a natural and a man-made catastrophe that resulted in the death of over 1,500 of our neighbors. Millions of folks were marked by the tragedy.

data.quote: Death comes to all, but great achievements build a monument which shall endure until the sun grows cold.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: It is important to feel the anger without judging it, without attempting to find meaning in it. It may take many forms: anger at the health-care system, at life, at your loved one for leaving. Life is unfair. Death is unfair. Anger is a natural reaction to the unfairness of loss.

data.quote: If a man can bridge the gap between life and death, if he can live on after he's dead, then maybe he was a great man.

data.quote: Many that live deserve death. And some that die deserve life. Can you give it to them? Then do not be too eager to deal out death in judgement. For even the very wise cannot see all ends.

data.quote: Cursed is the man who dies, but the evil done by him survives.

data.quote: There is no lonelier man in death, except the suicide, than that man who has lived many years with a good wife and then outlived her. If two people love each other there can be no happy end to it.

data.quote: Attachment and aversion are the root cause of karma, and karma originates from infatuation. Karma is the root cause of birth and death, and these are said to be the source of misery. None can escape the effect of their own past karma.

data.quote: Love is anterior to life, posterior to death, initial of creation, and the exponent of breath.

data.quote: Life is hard. Then you die. Then they throw dirt in your face. Then the worms eat you. Be grateful it happens in that order.

data.quote: In Hinduism, Shiva is a deity who represents transformation. Through destruction and restoration, Shiva reminds us that endings are beginnings, and that our world is constantly undergoing a cycle of birth, death and rebirth.

data.quote: Football (soccer) is a matter of life and death, except more important.

data.quote: You know, the Bible is so clear. Go to Genesis chapter nine and you will find the death penalty clearly stated in Genesis chapter nine... God ordains the death penalty!

data.quote: The goal of all life is death.

data.quote: Guilt is perhaps the most painful companion of death.

data.quote: One-third of our people were dangerously ill, getting worse hourly, and we felt sure of meeting the same fate, with death as our only prospect, which in such a country was much worse yet.

data.quote: Justifying conscription to promote the cause of liberty is one of the most bizarre notions ever conceived by man! Forced servitude, with the risk of death and serious injury as a price to live free, makes no sense.

data.quote: Do the thing you fear most and the death of fear is certain.

data.quote: I thank my God for graciously granting me the opportunity of learning that death is the key which unlocks the door to our true happiness.

data.quote: There are worse things in life than death. Have you ever spent an evening with an insurance salesman?

In a death-and-rebirth sense.

data.quote: Life and death appeared to me ideal bounds, which I should first break through, and pour a torrent of light into our dark world.

data.quote: The monuments of the nations are all protests against nothingness after death so are statues and inscriptions so is history.

data.quote: The compact which exists between the North and the South is a covenant with death and an agreement with hell.

data.quote: We're scared to death to try new things because we think we have to get it right the first time.

data.quote: It is vain for the coward to flee death follows close behind it is only by defying it that the brave escape.

data.quote: After your death you will be what you were before your birth.

data.quote: Death has its revelations: the great sorrows which open the heart open the mind as well; light comes to us with our grief. As for me, I have faith; I believe in a future life. How could I do otherwise? My daughter was a soul; I saw this soul. I touched it, so to speak.

data.quote: I don't believe in death, neither in flesh nor in spirit.

data.quote: I feel monotony and death to be almost the same.

data.quote: What an encouraging thought that Jesus - our beloved Husband - can find comfort in our lowly feeble gifts! Can this be, for it seems far too good to be true? data.quote: Life levels all men. Death reveals the eminent.

data.quote: Loss and possession, death and life are one, There falls no shadow where there shines no sun.

data.quote: A face to lose youth for, to occupy age With the dream of, meet death with.

data.quote: One is still what one is going to cease to be and already what one is going to become. One lives one's death, one dies one's life.

data.quote: What we have done for ourselves alone dies with us what we have done for others and the world remains and is immortal.

data.quote: I'll sleep when I'm dead.

data.quote: For death is no more than a turning of us over from time to eternity.

data.quote: Racism and injustice and violence sweep our world, bringing a tragic harvest of heartache and death.

data.quote: We sometimes congratulate ourselves at the moment of waking from a troubled dream it may be so the moment after death.
data.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

data.quote: When life is victorious, there is birth; when it is thwarted, there is death. A warrior is always engaged in a life-and-death struggle for Peace.
data.author: Morihei Ueshiba

data.quote: I support the death penalty. But I also think there has to be no margin for error.
data.author: George Ryan

data.quote: Death may be the King of terrors... but Jesus is the King of kings!
data.author: Dwight L. Moody

data.quote: The world is put back by the death of every one who has to sacrifice the development of his or her peculiar gifts to conventionality.
data.author: Florence Nightingale

data.quote: Once you start doing only what you've already proven you can do, you're on the road to death.
data.author: Jerry Seinfeld

data.quote: As a parent, it's my responsibility to equip my child to do this - to grieve when grief is necessary and to realize that life is still profoundly beautiful and worth living despite the fact that we inevitably lose one another and that life ends, and we don't know what happens after death.
data.author: Sam Harris

data.quote: True love makes the thought of death frequent, easy, without terrors; it merely becomes the standard of comparison, the price one would pay for many things.
data.author: Stendhal

data.quote: Smoking is the now the principal avoidable cause of premature death in Britain. It hits the worst off people hardest of all. Smoking is one of the principal causes of the health gap which leads to poorer people being ill more often and dying sooner.
data.author: Frank Dobson

data.quote: The Goddess of Old Europe and Ancient Crete represented the unity of life in nature, delight in the diversity of form, the powers of birth, death and regeneration.
data.author: Carol P. Christ

data.quote: There is no fundamental difference between the preparation for death and the practice of dying, and spiritual practice leading to enlightenment.
data.author: Stanislav Grof

data.quote: Since 1957, black people have experienced double-digit unemployment - in good times and bad times. Look at the population of African Americans in prison. They represent more than half the population of prisoners in the country, 55 percent of those on death row.
data.author: Danny Glover

data.quote: The best news of the Christian gospel is that the supremely glorious Creator of the universe has acted in Jesus Christ's death and resurrection to remove every obstacle between us and himself so that we may find everlasting joy in seeing and savoring his infinite beauty.
data.author: John Piper

data.quote: I think that beauty can injure you to death. It can cause an injury that can never be cured. Or it can so traumatise you, your life changes direction. The beauty of the harmony of nature that is forever lost, or a daily rite that you perform, or diving into the sea for a swim. Those experiences are going to mark you.
data.author: Toni Servillo

data.quote: The glories of our blood and state, Are shadows, not substantial things; There is no armour against fate, Death lays his icy hand on kings. Scepter and crown must tumble down, And, in the dust, be equal made With the poor crooked scythe and spade.
data.author: James Shirley

data.quote: Of all the gods only death does not desire gifts.
data.author: Aeschylus

data.quote: The fear of death is the most unjustified of all fears, for there's no risk of accident for someone who's dead.
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: I have never killed a man, but I have read many obituaries with great pleasure.
data.author: Clarence Darrow

data.quote: I decided to devote my life to telling the story because I felt that having survived I owe something to the dead. and anyone who does not remember betrays them again.
data.author: Elie Wiesel

data.quote: Those who have the strength and the love to sit with a dying patient in the silence that goes beyond words will know that this moment is neither frightening nor painful, but a peaceful cessation of the functioning of the body.
data.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

data.quote: No one can confidently say that he will still be living tomorrow.
data.author: Euripides

data.quote: Men fear death as children fear to go in the dark; and as that natural fear in children is increased by tales, so is the other.
data.author: Francis Bacon

data.quote: I'm gonna live till I die.
data.author: Frank Sinatra

data.quote: I've looked that old scoundrel death in the eye many times but this time I think he has me on the ropes.
data.author: Douglas MacArthur

data.quote: Death is a delightful hiding place for weary men.
data.author: Herodotus

data.quote: Pale Death beats equally at the poor man's gate and at the palaces of kings.
data.author: Horace

data.quote: If physical death is the price that I must pay to free my white brothers and sisters from a permanent death of the spirit, then nothing can be more redemptive.
data.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

data.quote: Someone has to die in order that the rest of us should value life more.
data.author: Virginia Woolf

data.quote: Even at our birth, death does but stand aside a little. And every day he looks towards us and muses somewhat to himself whether that day or the next he will draw nigh.
data.author: Robert Bolt

data.quote: We should weep for men at their birth, not at their death.
data.author: Charles de Montesquieu

data.quote: Not the torturer will scare me, nor the body's final fall, nor the barrels of death's rifles, nor the shadows on the wall, nor the night when to the ground the last dim star of pain, is hurled but the blind indifference of a merciless, unfeeling world.
data.author: Roger Waters

data.quote: Death is the golden key that opens the palace of eternity.
data.author: John Milton
